Crimes.Crime_Name: Kidnapping and/or extortion in urban and rural locations, especially in Caracas
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding no risk of persecution and a viable internal flight alternative (IFA) existed
Crimes.Governing_Law: Refugee law, specifically well-founded fear of persecution and internal flight alternative principles
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board ignored evidence of ongoing threats to applicant's family and widespread kidnapping/extortion reports in Caracas
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board’s decision set aside, case remitted for re-determination
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On claimant to prove well-founded fear of persecution and lack of viable IFA
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Corroborative evidence from family members about ongoing threats was disregarded
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Claimants must prove a well-founded fear of persecution and absence of a safe internal relocation option
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide adequate reasons or reference documentary evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution due to extortion by guerrilla forces
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to engage with key evidence, raising fairness concerns
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Ongoing threats to family, country condition reports on crime in Venezuela
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), international refugee law
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Lack of proper assessment of persecution risk and IFA
Crimes.Court_Result: Remanded for reassessment by a different panel
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Jurisprudence on refugee protection and internal flight alternative
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated; implied rejection of claim by Board
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Allowance of judicial review and remittal for re-determination
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Rule 326 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Rules
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA (Federal Court jurisdiction), Section 97(1) (stay of removal)
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada (IRB)
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Venezuelan national seeking refugee protection in Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of persecution due to extortion by armed groups

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Victim_Status: Individual targeted due to extortion and threats
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Ongoing threats after fleeing, targeting of family members
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: No indication of applicant involvement in criminal activity
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient corroborative evidence from family and documentation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board failed to properly assess credibility despite supporting evidence
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk of harm upon return
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Life-threatening due to unresolved extortion and threats
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – individual and family specifically threatened
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Rural and urban areas of Venezuela
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to reference documentary evidence or justify IFA conclusion
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Application for judicial review under Rule 326
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Threatened physical violence in context of extortion
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Pattern of violence linked to extortion demands
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: No indication of applicant criminal history
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – potential for serious bodily harm
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Documentary evidence of ongoing threats present but ignored
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board did not adequately challenge or analyze credibility
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Significant risk of assault upon return
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – based on prior extortion incident
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Definition of Convention refugee under s. 97(1)
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Insufficient reasoning on IFA and risk assessment

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim arising from forced payments under threat
Crimes.Victim_Status: Civilian victim of coercive financial demand
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Threats of violence if payment not made
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – part of systematic armed group behavior
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Strong evidence including post-flight threats to family
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Continuing risk due to unresolved conflict with armed group
Crimes.Risk_Type: Persecution based on political opinion or membership in social group
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – individual singled out for extortion
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Venezuela, including urban centers like Caracas
Crimes.Legal_Provision: s. 97(1) IRPA – definition of protected person
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to address key evidence on risk and IFA
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Application for leave and judicial review
